alert.note: Alert for Cocke; Greene; Hamblen; Jefferson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 15 at 2:57AM CDT until August 15 at 4:15AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Cocke County in east Tennessee... West Central Greene County in east Tennessee... Southeastern Hamblen County in east Tennessee... Northeastern Jefferson County in east Tennessee... * Until 515 AM EDT. * At 357 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.25 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Morristown, White Pine, Baneberry, Mosheim, Lowland, Bybee and Mohawk. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
